title: Three Types of Faith
introduction: Krishna describes how the three modes of nature influence our faith, worship, food choices, and lifestyle.

shlokas.sanskrit: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः | रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ||
shlokas.transliteration: āyuḥ-sattva-balārogya-sukha-prīti-vivardhanāḥ | rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛdyā āhārāḥ sāttvika-priyāḥ
shlokas.translation: Foods which increase life, vitality, strength, health, happiness and satisfaction, which are juicy, fatty, wholesome, and pleasing to the heart, are dear to those in goodness.
shlokas.modern: Eat real food that makes you feel good - not processed junk, not virtue-signaling restrictive diets. Foods that give you energy, make you healthy, and taste good. Your grandma knew this. Somehow we forgot and started eating chemicals. Just eat actual food. You know what's good for you. Trust your body, not Instagram wellness influencers.

shlokas.sanskrit: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् | असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ||
shlokas.transliteration: aśraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛtaṁ ca yat | asad ity ucyate pārtha na ca tat pretya no iha
shlokas.translation: Anything done without faith - whether sacrifice, charity, austerity or any other act - is useless in this life and the next.
shlokas.modern: If you do stuff without believing in it, it's pointless. Going through the motions at work? Waste. Donating just for tax write-off? Empty. Exercising because you 'should' not because you value health? Won't last. Whatever you do, do it with conviction. Or don't do it at all. Half-assed effort with no heart behind it helps nobody, including you.
